title: Dermatology Quiz: Answers
summary:
Key ideas:
- Americans who drive a lot get more UV light on the left side of their faces, which may contribute to left-sided skin cancer.
- Sun exposure may protect against cancer.
- A randomized trial showed that Botox improved depression symptoms in 52% of patients versus 15% of the placebo group.
- The facial feedback hypothesis suggests that facial musculature plays a role in emotions, and paralyzing frowning muscles makes it harder to feel sad.
- Botox may improve mood in healthy people without depression.

Key learnings:
- Interesting medical facts can lead to unexpected findings and ideas.
- New interventions can have both positive and negative implications, including cost and utilitarian calculus.

Key questions:
- How does sun exposure protect against cancer?
- Is the Botox effect susceptible to happiness set points?
- How does the cost of Botox compare to other interventions in the utilitarian calculus?
